title: 104_s1947
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends wire and electronic communications laws to include the use of a clone pager. It also makes changes to Chapter 206 of the United States Code. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. This amendment affects the chapter heading, analysis, and section 3121. The amendment to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code includes clone pagers along with trap and trace devices. This affects section 3121, 3122, and 3123 by adding clone pagers to the existing provisions. The amendment to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code includes clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. This impacts sections 3121, 3122, and 3123 by incorporating clone pagers into the current provisions. The amendment to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code adds clone pagers to the existing provisions for trap and trace devices. This affects sections 3121, 3122, and 3123 by including clone pagers in the regulations. The amendment adds provisions for clone pagers in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, alongside trap and trace devices. Section 3125 is updated to include clone pagers in the regulations. The amendment includes provisions for clone pagers in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, along with trap and trace devices. Sections 3125, 3126, and 3127 are updated to incorporate clone pagers in the regulations. The amendment adds a definition for "clone pager" in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, allowing users to receive messages simultaneously with the paging device user.
